article.headline: Northwestern 66, Loyola, Md. 60
article.story: EVANSTON, Ill. (AP) -- Northwestern had a rocky first half against Loyola of Maryland but finished with a 66-60 win Wednesday night. Led by Vince Scott's team-high 16 points and 14 points from Craig Moore, the Wildcats (9-3) overcame a 33-26 halftime deficit and took the lead 45-42 on Moore's 3-pointer with 9:53 to go in the game. Scott was 7-for-7 from the field. "The points I had tonight, any kid out of the stands could have had," Scott said. "They are just lay ups off back door cuts and stuff like that. I made them at least." Tim Doyle (13) and Kevin Coble (11) also finished in double figures for the Wildcats and had six assists and four steals apiece. Marquis Sullivan and Gerald Brown led the Greyhounds (5-5). Sullivan finished with a game-high 17 points and Brown had 15 before fouling out with 1:25 to go in the game. "You have to know how to play with fouls. I don't think Gerald particularly handled that well, but that's why we're learning," Loyola head coach Jimmy Patsos said. "I take responsibility as a coach that maybe I should have done some things to take some pressure off of him." The pair led Loyola's fist-half surge as Sullivan went 4-for-5 from 3-point range, while Brown hit nearly everything for 13 points off six field goals. "They outplayed us pretty badly in the last ten minutes of that first half," Northwestern head coach Bill Carmody said. "I thought it was a very good game," Carmody said. "We competed hard, they're a good team."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
